meanings.definition: The number of elements in a set.
meanings.sent1: The cardinality of the group was five, meaning there were five members in total.
meanings.sent2: The cardinality of the class was twenty, indicating there were twenty students present.
meanings.sent3: The cardinality of the team made it easy to divide them into equal groups for the game.
meanings.sent4: The cardinality of the audience filled the entire stadium, creating a vibrant atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The cardinality of the collection made it clear that it was extensive and diverse.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being cardinal.
meanings.sent1: The cardinality of his leadership was evident in the way he guided the team.
meanings.sent2: Her cardinality as a teacher shone through in her dedication to her students.
meanings.sent3: The cardinality of his kindness knew no bounds, touching everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The cardinality of her wisdom was like a beacon, guiding others through challenges.
meanings.sent5: His cardinality as a friend was unmatched, always there to offer support.
